alert.note: Alert for Hancock (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 5:16PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN HANCOCK AND NORTHEASTERN OHIO COUNTIES THROUGH 445 PM CDT... At 415 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Knottsville, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Fordsville, Goering, Pellville, Deanefield, Victoria Crossroads, Floral, Patesville, Cabot, Herbert and Haynesville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for south central Indiana...and central Kentucky.
